<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Elemental Embellish](/Feats.aspx?ID=2581) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Suli" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=310" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 110 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You can summon a harmless but impressive elemental display. You become trained in [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7). If you would automatically become trained in Intimidation (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. When you [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53) a foe, if you choose to Demoralize via an elemental display, Demoralize loses the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) trait and gains the [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) trait, and you don't take a penalty when you attempt to Demoralize a creature that doesn't understand your language.
name: Elemental Embellish
